Study: Characteristics and Outcomes of COVID-19 Patients in New York City's Public Hospital System
Study Population: New York City Health and Hospital between March 5 and April 9, 2020

Study: Interim Analysis of Risk Factors for Severe Outcomes among a Cohort of Hospitalized Adults Identified through the U.S. Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)-Associated Hospitalization Surveillance Network (COVID-NET)
Multivariate adjustment: age, sex, race/ethnicity, smoker, hypertension, obesity, diabetes, chronic lung disease, cardiovascular disease, neurologic disease, renal disease, immunosuppression, hematologic disorders, and rheumatologic or autoimmune disease
Study Population: 124 counties located in 14 states 113 (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Georgia, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, New Mexico, New 114 York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, and Utah)

Study: Interim Analysis of Risk Factors for Severe Outcomes among a Cohort of Hospitalized Adults Identified through the U.S. Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)-Associated Hospitalization Surveillance Network (COVID-NET)
Study Population: 123 counties located in 14 states 113 (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Georgia, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, New Mexico, New 114 York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, and Utah)

Study: OpenSAFELY: factors associated with COVID-19-related hospital death in the linked electronic health records of 17 million adult NHS patients.
Multivariate adjustment: age, gender, obesity, smoking status, diabetes, cancer, hematological malignancy, asthma, chronic respiratory disease, heart disease, hypertension, chronic liver disease, stroke or dementia, other neurological disease, reduced kidney function, organ transplant, spleen disease, rheumatoid arthritis/lupus/psoriasis, immunosuppression
Study Population: TPP general practice in England from February 1 to April 25, 2020.

Study: The role of comorbidities and clinical predictors of severe disease in COVID-19: a systematic review and meta-analysis Emails
Study Population: PubMed, Scopus, EMBASE, Web of Science, and Google Scholar searched through March 12 2027

Study: Association between rRT-PCR test results upon admission and outcome in hospitalized chest CT-Positive COVID-19 patients; a provincial retrospective cohort with active follow-up
Multivariate adjustment: Age, ICU admission, PCR test results, admission week, number of comorbidities, cardiovascular disease, chronic lung disease, diabetes, chronic kidney disease, gender, hypertension

Study: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020 [MMWR Morb Mortal Wkly Rep]
Study Population: CDC passive surveillance registry as of March 28, 2025
